messages.title: Dear Elector
messages.content: There are only a few weeks to go until the general election. I am writing to you because if the Conservatives win that election, David Cameron has asked me to be Chancellor of the Exchequer.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: It will be my job to get Britain's economy moving – ensuring that banks grant loans to families and businesses and that the budget is balanced without excessive public spending.
Cut waste in NHS while increasing spending every year – focus on reducing costs yet investing more in the NHS.

issues.economy: We will end the waste and reckless spending. We will stop the tax rises planned by Labour. We will take immediate steps to cut the deficit.
issues.health: We will end the waste in the NHS. We will increase spending on the NHS every year.

housing.content: We will bring to an end the era of reckless lending and the housing boom and bust.

quotes.text: I hope you will take the chance to vote for that change.

images.caption: George Osborne's letter to the electorate.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The letter outlines key priorities if the Conservatives win the election, such as balancing the budget, supporting the NHS, and promoting job creation and new apprenticeships.
